text: Do we have a package that calculates sample sizes given expected effect sizes/variability and desired power for multi-group comparisons? I found <https://github.com/johnmyleswhite/PowerAnalysis.jl> but it seems to be doing two-group comparisons only? I have an experimental design which involves six groups (formed based on the levels of two categorical variables, one with 3 and the other with 2 levels) and need to test for differences between them for both continuous and binary measures.

text: Thanks, that seems related but if I'm not mistaken that also only does two groups? Having done some reading yesterday it seems to me that most fields talk of this as a "two way anova" (which appears to be a fixed effects model in disguise?) and I found some sample size numbers here (<https://www.graphpad.com/support/faq/how-can-i-determine-needed-sample-size-for-an-experiment-to-be-analyzed-by-two-way-anova/|https://www.graphpad.com/support/faq/how-can-i-determine-needed-sample-size-for-an-experiment-to-be-analyzed-by-two-way-anova/>) which I can replicate using an R package called pwr2. It seems the problem there is reduced to specifying the smallest effect size between two groups that one wants to measure
